info.title: Task and Task Status API
info.description: A `Task` is work that can be assigned to an Entity. This could be a service call, moving job, package delivery, food order or any other job. There is no limit on number of tasks that a user can create and assign to Entities. Once you create a Task you will be able to assign it to one or more Entities i.e. your tech, driver or crew members. Once a task is assigned to a crew member they can report status on the task e.g. `on their way to task`, `started`, `complete` etc. Also you can fetch the live estimate of the crew or driver arrival to the task location and task completion using our APIs. `Task Status` is a specific status entry related to a task. It can be reported by the office scheduler, internal system, assigned crew, customer (Thanks to our sms & email relay and our ability to attach note to a live task directly) and in some cases arrivy system. Arrivy supports variety of Task Status types and let users customize that statuses they want for each of their different job types.

post.description: Adds a task to your account, along with all the assigned entities and resources. Note that you may provide the IDs of existing entities or resources if these are available.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Title of the task. This is optional but we strongly recommend setting it as it shows up on the Arrivy Dashboard for Operations and Support Teams.

parameters.name: start_datetime
parameters.description: Start date and time of the task. This is a required field for all tasks except for the ones that are marked as UNSCHEDULED. This needs to be ISO 8601. Supported format is YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZZ e.g. 2016-10-14T08:00:00+01:00

parameters.name: end_datetime
parameters.description: End date and time of the task. This is an expected end time as in many cases the end time isn’t known before-hand. Please provide this value as it helps our estimation and monitoring engine. This needs to be ISO 8601. Supported format is YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZZ e.g. 2016-10-14T08:00:00+01:00

parameters.name: enable_time_window_display
parameters.description: True indicates that customer should not see the exact end datetime provided above. Instead, a time-window based on the start time will be provided.

parameters.name: time_window_start
parameters.description: Value of customer time window (in mins). Customer will see Start Time to Start Time + (this time) as the window of the task. This will only have effect if `enable_time_window_display` is set as `True` in the payload. Arrivy monitors this time window and if the crew expected arrival time goes beyond the window we fire late alerts to the dispatcher and operations.

parameters.name: unscheduled
parameters.description: True/False which indicates if task is unscheduled or not. If set to 'True' the task shows up **only** in unscheduled list in Arrivy Web Portal. It can later be made scheduled via API or Web Portal.

parameters.name: extra_fields
parameters.description: Custom fields provided as key value pair stringified as JSON. This is useful as it can help store essentially any data with the task. These key-values pairs will be available on Arrivy Mobile apps for the crew and also sent via webhook notifications (can later be used for correlation).

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Details of the task. Typically, these are instructions related to the actual work that needs to be done in the task. This is shared with assigned crew members aka entities on Arrivy Mobile Apps.

parameters.name: customer_first_name
parameters.description: First name of the customer.

parameters.name: customer_last_name
parameters.description: Last name of the customer.

parameters.name: customer_email
parameters.description: Email of the customer.

parameters.name: customer_company_name
parameters.description: Customer's company name.

parameters.name: customer_address_line_1
parameters.description: Customer address line 1.

parameters.name: customer_address_line_2
parameters.description: Customer address line 2.

parameters.name: customer_city
parameters.description: Customer's city.

parameters.name: customer_state
parameters.description: Customer's state and province.

parameters.name: customer_country
parameters.description: Customer's country.

parameters.name: customer_zipcode
parameters.description: Customer's zipcode.

parameters.name: customer_exact_location.
parameters.description: Exact latitude and longitude of customer location. Expected format is a JSON string with these two keys `lat` and `lng`.

parameters.name: customer_mobile_number
parameters.description: Mobile number of the customer.

parameters.name: customer_phone
parameters.description: Secondary Phone number of the customer. We don't use it for our sms notifications unless the above mentioned mobile number isn't provided.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: If you already know the customer's id from a previous Arrivy task provide that. Otherwise, keep it blank. This is optional like most of the fields here.

parameters.name: notifications
parameters.description: A key value pair as JSON stringified. Possible key options are sms and email. Indicate true or false to turn on or off each of these channels for customer notifications.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: String source of the task e.g. it can be google or any other calendar or your own system.

parameters.name: source_id
parameters.description: Identifier to correlate the task with the any other id in some other system. This field is `deprecated` since we have introduced external_id.

parameters.name: external_url
parameters.description: External url for the task. This could be a complete URL to access this task in your own enterprise system. This link will be available on Crew Mobile Apps too.

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: Typically, an id from a client system.

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: Indicates ID of the group within the company that this task belongs to. This is an internal arrivy group ID that should be known before-hand in order to create task for that group.

parameters.name: template
parameters.description: Indicates ID of the template which should be associated with the task. This is an internal arrivy template ID that should be known before-hand in order to associate template with the task.

parameters.name: additional_addresses
parameters.description: An array of address objects as JSON stringified. This is used to store multiple addresses on a task e.g. a move typically has two address. each address Object will have attributes like `title`, `address_line_1`, `address_line_2`, `city`, `state`, `country`, `zipcode` and `exact_location`. exact_location is a JSON string having two keys `lat` and `lng`.

parameters.name: entity_ids
parameters.description: Comma separated string of entity ids to indicate assigned entites aka crew members or drivers. These entity ids are the ids returned by Arrivy in response of /api/entities/new or /api/entities.

parameters.name: resource_ids
parameters.description: Comma separated string of resource ids to indicate assigned resources. These resource ids are the ids returned by Arrivy in response of /api/resources/new or /api/resources.

parameters.name: items
parameters.description: An array of item objects as JSON stringified. This is used to store details of items which are to be delivered/picked up from customer's location or warehouse etc. Each item object will have attributes like `id`, `name`, `description`, `sku`, `lpn`, `model`, `weight`, `weight_unit`(it should be ISO unit), `image_id`, `image_name`, `image_path`, `color` and `type`. **NOTE:** `id` and `type` are required attributes in each item object and also please specify `type` as `DELIVERY` for the items which are to be delivered and `PICKUP` for the items which are to be picked up. The `id` and `lpn` of each item needs to be unique.

parameters.name: company_id
parameters.description: Optional param to add task of a sub-company. Please reach out to us at dev.support@arrivy.com before you start using this field.

description.example: End datetime should be later than Start datetime

get.description: Returns the entire task stucture as JSON given the task_id of the task.

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.description: ID of the task.

parameters.name: company_id
parameters.description: Optional param to get task of a sub-company. Please reach out to us at dev.support@arrivy.com before you start using this field.

put.description: This PUT call can be used to change any field values on the task. Just send the values that you would like updated. Most common use is modifying entities_id to change crew assignment on a task.

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.description: ID of the task.

parameters.name: title

The `id` and `lpn` of each item needs to be unique.

parameters.name: company_id
parameters.description: Optional param to update task of a sub-company. Please reach out to us at dev.support@arrivy.com before you start using this field.

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.description: ID of the task.

parameters.name: company_id
parameters.description: Optional param to delete task of a sub-company. Please reach out to us at dev.support@arrivy.com before you start using this field.

get.description: List all tasks. You can specify a few fields to limit your search (highly recommended). Possible URL params are explained.

parameters.name: entity_id
parameters.description: This field helps return tasks of a specific entity.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Date & Time of the query. This needs to be ISO8601. Supported format is YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZZ e.g. '2016-10-14T08:00:00+01:00'. Plus sign needs to be url encoded as these are query params.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Date & Time of the query. This needs to be ISO8601. Supported format is YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZZ e.g. '2016-10-14T08:00:00+01:00'. Plus sign needs to be url encoded as these are query params.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Default value is 1 if not supplied.

parameters.name: items_per_page
parameters.description: Default value is 500 if not supplied.

parameters.name: unscheduled
parameters.description: Default value is false. True indicates that only unscheduled tasks should be returned. To learn more about unscheduled tasks please checkout https://help.arrivy.com/tasks-and-calendar/unscheduled-tasks/

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: Returns tasks for a given customer_id.

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: Returns task for a given external_id.

parameters.name: show_details
parameters.description: If true then 10 latest Task statuses and ratings will be included in the response as well.

parameters.name: company_id
parameters.description: Optional param to get task list of a sub-company. Please reach out to us at dev.support@arrivy.com before you start using this field.

get.description: Get estimated arrival time of task assignee at task.

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.description: ID of the task.

parameters.name: company_id
parameters.description: Optional param to get estimate arrival of task of a sub-company. Please reach out to us at dev.support@arrivy.com before you start using this field.

get.description: Get the rating left by the customer at task completion.

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.description: ID of the task.

parameters.name: company_id
parameters.description: Optional param to get rating of task of a sub-company. Please reach out to us at dev.support@arrivy.com before you start using this field.
